snippet: The nations that adhere to the International Criminal Court have agreed to special rules for national leaders, but human rights groups warned that a category of privileged defendant had been created.
lead_paragraph: The nations that adhere to the International Criminal Court have agreed to special rules for national leaders, but human rights groups warned that a category of privileged defendant had been created.
abstract: News analysis; International Criminal Court is once again wrestling with the question of whether the law should prevail or bend to the demands of diplomacy and political stability as it takes up the trials of Kenyan Pres Uhuru Kenyatta and his deputy William Ruto.

headline.main: International Criminal Court Wrestles With Applying Law, or Bending
headline.print_headline: A Less-Equal Court, in the Name of Stability

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
